title: Nossa Senhora do Livramento (Capelas de)
body:
In the parish of Caniço, there was a chapel dedicated to Nossa Senhora do Livramento, in the place that still bears this name today. It was the subject of an ancient and popular pilgrimage, which still takes place at the parish church, since the time when the chapel was demolished, of which there are no traces today. It seems to have been built around the mid-17th century, and its foundation is attributed to Sebastião de Oliveira, who owned land in that place.

With the same invocation, we also know of a chapel in the parish of Ponta do Sol, another in the parish of Monte, another in the parish of Estreito da Calheta, and a fourth in the parish of S. Vicente.

The first of these chapels was ordered to be built by Diogo Ferreira de Mesquita and his wife D. Isabel de Meneses, in 1656, being endowed by a deed of September 14 of the same year; the second was built by Inácio Ferreira Pinto in 1684, and rebuilt a century later by João José Bettencourt de Freitas, with the inspection for the celebration of worship taking place on July 5, 1784; the third, of recent foundation, was ordered to be built by D. Inacia Bettencourt Perestrelo in the year 1858, with the canonical inspection taking place on September 11 of the same year and the fourth was erected in 1685 by Father Manue1 Gomes Garcês.

The chapel of Nossa Senhora do Livramento in the parish of Estreito da Calheta is currently (1921) owned by Francisco Bettencourt Pimenta and is located in Lombo dos Reis.

Diogo Ferreira de Mesquita: Ordered the construction of the first chapel
D. Inacia Bettencourt Perestrelo: Ordered the construction of the third chapel
Francisco Bettencourt Pimenta: Owner of the chapel in Estreito da Calheta

1784: Inspection for the celebration of worship in the second chapel
1860: Canonical inspection of the third chapel
1921: Year in which the chapel in Estreito da Calheta was owned by Francisco Bettencourt Pimenta
